results.title: Divertimento
results.creator_credit: Verity Films and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: To scientists seeking wider knowledge of the ways and uses of oil, the microscope reveals an unusual world of beauty. Optical devices and cinemicroscopy are used to show oil’s hidden beauty.

results.title: Diverse visions: twelve Australian mid to late career artists
results.brief_description: Artists included are: Charles Blackman, Mike Brown, Ray Crooke, Rosalie Gascoigne, Inge King, Robert Klippel, Les Kossatz, Alun Leach-Jones, John Perceval, Gareth Sansom, Gordon Sheperdson, John Wolseley. Eight of the artists speak about their work on location at an exhibition. Catalogue essay writers speak about the work of the artists unable to appear. The documentary was devised by John Massy.

results.title: Diver's logbook: the reef at Heron Island
results.brief_description: Underwater photography of the varied marine life of a coral reef, showing living corals and plants, sea anemones, sea cucumbers and a number of species of fish.

results.title: Diva
results.creator_credit: Galaxie, Irene Silberman and Jean-Jacques Beineix
results.brief_description: A music-loving mailman bootleg-tapes the concert of a superstar diva who has never made a recording. He finds himself in hot water when the tape is mixed up with a second tape that will incriminate gangsters. Based on a novel by Delacorta and starring Wilhemina Wiggins-Fernandez as the diva.

results.title: Diva
results.brief_description:
“For his first feature, Jean-Jacques Beineix borrowed the formal innovations of the French avant-garde - Godard’s colors and conflicting tones, Rivette’s screwball thriller plotting - for a work of unalloyed entertainment, which was such a sharp commercial idea it’s a wonder no one had thought of it before. A young postal messenger who worships an American opera singer makes an illegal tape of one of her recitals; meanwhile, a dying prostitute drops a cassette of her tape-recorded confessions, which will help indict a drug ring, into his mail pouch. Beineix stays too close to the themes and emotions of the formula cult film - a morbid romanticism, a lingering cuteness - for the picture to take off into art, but any film with this much stylistic assurance is impossible to fully resist.” Reference: Dave Kerr. Chicago Reader. Online. http://onfilm.chireader.com Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1982: Best cinematography for Philippe Rousselot ; Best sound recording for Jean-Pierre Ruh ; Best music for Vladimir Cosma.

Credits: Producer, Irene Silberman ; director, Jean-Jacques Beineix ; writers, Jean-Jacques Beineix, Jean Van Hamme ; photography, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Vladimir Cosma, Alfredo Catalani, Charles Gounod ; art direction, Hilton Mc Connico.
Cast: Frederic Andrei, Roland Bertin, Wilhelminia Wiggins Fernandez, Thuy An Luu, Dominique Pinon, Richard Bohringer.

results.title: Dites-Lui Que Je L'aime = Tell Her that I'm in Love
results.creator_credit: Maurice Bernart, Hubert Niogret and Claude Miller
results.brief_description:
David is an accountant. He leaves town every Friday, pretending he is going to take care of his parents at their old people’s home. But actually his parents are dead, and he spends the week-ends converting a chalet. He intends to live there with Lise, a woman he knows and loves since childhood. But Lise is married to another and has a baby. David’s mad love does not see those facts as an obstacle…

Credits: Producers, Maurice Bernart, Hubert Niogret ; director, Claude Miller ; writers, Claude Miller, Luc Beraud ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Alain Jomy ; art director, Hilton McConnico.
Cast: Christian Clavier, Jacques Denis, Gerard Depardieu, Dominique Laffin, Miou-Miou, Claude Pieplu, Josiane Balasko.

results.title: Disturbing behavior = Disturbing behaviour
results.creator_credit: Beacon Pictures, Hoyts Film Partnership, Village Roadshow Pictures, Armyan Bernstein, Jonathan Shestack and David Nutter
results.brief_description: This teen thriller, set in a small American port town named Cradle Bay, has echoes of the “Stepford wives”, albeit played out in a more baleful and graphic manner. In this deceptively banal location a science experiment is being conducted on errant students, each of whom are hand selected then essentially lobotomised, after which they start to behave like ‘perfect’ students. After a family tragedy, the Clark family move from Chicago to Cradle Bay, and Steve, (a teenager struggling with a past tragedy), tries to comes to terms with the odd behaviours that he sees around him. Gavin and UV (two arch outsiders) implore Steve that danger abounds behind the seemingly A-grade students, the Blue Ribbons, whose violent outbursts belie their otherwise purist nature. Katie Holms plays Rachel, a rebel bad-girl who teams up with Steve to try to uncover the mystery and save future students from a sinister fate. David Nutter’s feature debut pays due attention to the tropes of the genre, providing requisite thrills and tensions, beatings and romantic interludes, all to a soft-core punk-rock soundtrack. Cast includes James Marsden, Nick Stahl, Steve Railsback, Bruce Greenwood, Bill Sadler and Chad E. Donella.

results.title: District Commissioner
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Maslyn Williams and Shan Benson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
The work of a District Commissioner in the Papua New Guinea highlands. Follows Tom Ellis on patrol: establishing medical posts, providing agricultural advice and equipment, taking a populaiton census and later establishing a patrol post. Shows the importance of air-dropped supplies, until airstrips and roads are laid, and the value of roads to primitive people.

results.title: Distribution of plants and animals
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, John Walker and William Peltz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Studies plant and animal ecology. Traces the various factors which influence the distribution and survival of animals in a given geographical area. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Distribution of foods
results.brief_description: Studies the technological advances made in the methods of preserving and transporting foodstuffs, showing their relation to the distribution of perishable foods on a world scale, the flow of foods from producer to consumer, the problems which a limited family income raises, and the international trade and tariff barriers.
